required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CP-751,871 Treatment For Patients With Multiple Myeloma
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label Phase I Study Of CP-751,871 In Patients With Multiple Myeloma

brief_summary.textblock: This study represents the first-in-human study for CP-751,871. The study aimed to define the safety, tolerability, and maximum tolerated dose of CP-751,871 in patients with multiple myeloma through a dose escalation design.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Cycle 1 (Week 4 or Week 8)
primary_outcome.description: The highest dose level at which not more than 1 dose-limiting toxicity (DLT) was observed during Cycle 1 in 6 participants

secondary_outcome.measure: Single Dose End-of-infusion Concentration (Cinf) for CP-751,871
Single Dose Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) for CP-751,871
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: predose; 1; 24; 48; 72; 168; 336; 504, 672 and 1008 (for participants with an up to 8-week Cycle 1 only) hours postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Single Dose Volume of Distribution (Vz) for CP-751,871
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: predose; 1; 24; 48; 72; 168; 336; 504 and 672 and 1008 (for participants with an up to 8-week Cycle 1 only) hours postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Single Dose Plasma Decay Half-life (t1/2) for CP-751,871
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: predose; 1; 24; 48; 72; 168; 336; 504 and 672 and 1008 (for participants with an up to 8-week Cycle 1 only) hours postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Single Dose Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Extrapolated Infinite Time [AUC (0 - ∞)] for CP-751,871
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: predose; 1; 24; 48; 72; 168; 336; 504 and 672 and 1008 (for participants with an up to 8-week Cycle 1 only) hours postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Single Dose Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss) for CP-751,871
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: predose; 1; 24; 48; 72; 168; 336; 504 and 672 and 1008 (for participants with an up to 8-week Cycle 1 only) hours postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Single Dose Systemic Clearance (CL) for CP-751,871
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: predose; 1; 24; 48; 72; 168; 336; 504 and 672 and 1008 (for participants with an up to 8-week Cycle 1 only) hours postdose
1 hour postdose in Cycles 2 up to 16

secondary_outcome.measure: Multiple Dose Minimum Observed Plasma Trough Concentration (Cmin) for CP-751,871

secondary_outcome.description: The dose associated with PK exposure that was associated with 80% of the maximal effect based on down-regulation of insulin-like growth factor 1 receptor (IGF-1R) expression

secondary_outcome.measure: Human Anti-human Antibody (HAHA) Response to CP-751,871
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes predose in Cycle 1 and subsequent cycles, end of study visit (Days 30 and 60) for dose levels below 0.8 mg/kg; 30 minutes predose in Cycle 1 and last scheduled follow-up visit for dose levels greater than or equal to 0.8 mg/kg

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response (OR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 1 at predose/cycle, end of study (30-60 days post last dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with OR based on assessment of confirmed complete remission (CR) or confirmed partial remission (PR) according to Southwest Oncology Group (SWOG) criteria. CR were those with absence of bone marrow or blood findings of multiple myeloma. PR were those with a 50-74% reduction in the quantitative immunoglobulin, and if present, a 50-89% reduction in the urine M-component (Bence-Jones protein).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Time in weeks from start of study treatment to first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to cancer, whichever came first. Tumor progression was determined from oncologic assessment data (where data met the criteria for progressive disease [PD])

intervention.description: CP-751,871 was given at doses ranging from 0.025 mg/kg up to 20 mg/kg IV every 4 weeks until disease progression or lack of tolerability

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Previously treated multiple myeloma with a quantifiable serum (M spike ≥ 1 g/dL) and/or urine (≥ 200 mg/24-hr) paraprotein
- Adequate bone marrow, renal, liver and cardiac function
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group [ECOG] performance status less than or equal to 2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior allogeneic stem cell transplant (alloSCT)
- Myelosuppressive chemotherapy or immunotherapy within 3 weeks prior to treatment with CP-751,871
- Prior organ allograft
- Concurrent use of insulin, oral hypoglycemic medication, growth hormone (GH), or growth hormone inhibitors
- Female patients who are pregnant or lactating

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: CP-751,871 0.025 mg/kg
group.description: CP-751,871 0.025 milligram/kilogram (mg/kg) administered intravenously on Day 1 of Cycle 1 (4 weeks or 8 weeks), and dose of 50% from the Cycle 1 dose administered on Day 1 of subsequent cycles, starting from Cycle 2 (4 weeks)

group.description: CP-751,871 0.025, 0.05, 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.8, 1.5, 3 and 6 mg/kg administered intravenously on Day 1 of Cycle 1 (4 weeks or 8 weeks), and dose of 50% from the Cycle 1 dose administered on Day 1 of subsequent cycles, starting from Cycle 2 (4 weeks); CP-751,871 10 and 20 mg/kg administered intravenously on Day 1 of Cycle 1 (4 weeks or 8 weeks) and subsequent cycles, starting from Cycle 2 (4 weeks)

outcome.title: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD)
outcome.description: The highest dose level at which not more than 1 dose-limiting toxicity (DLT) was observed during Cycle 1 in 6 participants
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Cycle 1 (Week 4 or Week 8)
outcome.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug CP-751,871.

group.title: CP-751,871 0.025-20 mg/kg
group.description: CP-751,871 0.025, 0.05, 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.8, 1.5, 3 and 6 mg/kg administered intravenously on Day 1 of Cycle 1 (4 weeks or 8 weeks), and dose of 50% from the Cycle 1 dose administered on Day 1 of subsequent cycles, starting from Cycle 2 (4 weeks); CP-751,871 10 and 20 mg/kg administered intravenously on Day 1 of Cycle 1 (4 weeks or 8 weeks) and subsequent cycles, starting from Cycle 2 (4 weeks)

measure.title: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD)
measure.description: The highest dose level at which not more than 1 dose-limiting toxicity (DLT) was observed during Cycle 1 in 6 participants
measure.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug CP-751,871.

measurement_list.measurement: CP-751,871 was safe and well tolerated at dose levels up to 20 mg/kg, and MTD was not achieved.

outcome.title: Single Dose End-of-infusion Concentration (Cinf) for CP-751,871
outcome.population: All participants treated who had at least 1 concentration.

outcome.title: Pharmacodynamic-based Dose
outcome.description: The dose associated with PK exposure that was associated with 80% of the maximal effect based on down-regulation of insulin-like growth factor 1 receptor (IGF-1R) expression
outcome.population: Data from analysis of the PK/pharmacodynamic relationship could not permit a reliable estimate of the pharmacodynamic-based dose.

group.title: CP-751,871 0.025-20 mg/kg
group.description: CP-751,871 0.025, 0.05, 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.8, 1.5, 3 and 6 mg/kg administered intravenously on Day 1 of Cycle 1 (4 weeks or 8 weeks), and dose of 50% from the Cycle 1 dose administered on Day 1 of subsequent cycles, starting from Cycle 2 (4 weeks); CP-751,871 10 and 20 mg/kg administered intravenously on Day 1 of Cycle 1 (4 weeks or 8 weeks) and subsequent cycles, starting from Cycle 2 (4 weeks)

measure.title: Pharmacodynamic-based Dose
measure.description: The dose associated with PK exposure that was associated with 80% of the maximal effect based on down-regulation of insulin-like growth factor 1 receptor (IGF-1R) expression
measure.population: Data from analysis of the PK/pharmacodynamic relationship could not permit a reliable estimate of the pharmacodynamic-based dose.

outcome.title: Human Anti-human Antibody (HAHA) Response to CP-751,871
outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes predose in Cycle 1 and subsequent cycles, end of study visit (Days 30 and 60) for dose levels below 0.8 mg/kg; 30 minutes predose in Cycle 1 and last scheduled follow-up visit for dose levels greater than or equal to 0.8 mg/kg
outcome.population: All treated participants with HAHA samples collected at time points when circulating CP-751,871 concentrations were below the lower limit of quantification.

group.title: CP-751,871 0.025-20 mg/kg
group.description: CP-751,871 0.025, 0.05, 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.8, 1.5, 3 and 6 mg/kg administered intravenously on Day 1 of Cycle 1 (4 weeks or 8 weeks), and dose of 50% from the Cycle 1 dose administered on Day 1 of subsequent cycles, starting from Cycle 2 (4 weeks); CP-751,871 10 and 20 mg/kg administered intravenously on Day 1 of Cycle 1 (4 weeks or 8 weeks) and subsequent cycles, starting from Cycle 2 (4 weeks)

measure.title: Human Anti-human Antibody (HAHA) Response to CP-751,871
measure.population: All treated participants with HAHA samples collected at time points when circulating CP-751,871 concentrations were below the lower limit of quantification.

measurement_list.measurement: None of the analyzed samples were positive for anti-CP-751,871 antibodies, as suggested by a titer measurement of less than 3.32.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response (OR)
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with OR based on assessment of confirmed complete remission (CR) or confirmed partial remission (PR) according to Southwest Oncology Group (SWOG) criteria. CR were those with absence of bone marrow or blood findings of multiple myeloma. PR were those with a 50-74% reduction in the quantitative immunoglobulin, and if present, a 50-89% reduction in the urine M-component (Bence-Jones protein).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 1 at predose/cycle, end of study (30-60 days post last dose)
outcome.population: All participants who completed a minimum of 1 cycle of treatment were evaluable for response. Participants who developed early progressive disease (regardless of the duration of study treatment) prior to response evaluation were also evaluable for response.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response (OR)
measure.description: Percentage of participants with OR based on assessment of confirmed complete remission (CR) or confirmed partial remission (PR) according to Southwest Oncology Group (SWOG) criteria. CR were those with absence of bone marrow or blood findings of multiple myeloma. PR were those with a 50-74% reduction in the quantitative immunoglobulin, and if present, a 50-89% reduction in the urine M-component (Bence-Jones protein).
measure.population: All participants who completed a minimum of 1 cycle of treatment were evaluable for response. Participants who developed early progressive disease (regardless of the duration of study treatment) prior to response evaluation were also evaluable for response.

outcome.title: Time to Disease Progression
outcome.description: Time in weeks from start of study treatment to first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to cancer, whichever came first. Tumor progression was determined from oncologic assessment data (where data met the criteria for progressive disease [PD])
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to end of treatment
outcome.population: A substantial number of participants were not followed-up prior to disease progression, therefore time to disease progression was not estimated.

measure.description: Time in weeks from start of study treatment to first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to cancer, whichever came first. Tumor progression was determined from oncologic assessment data (where data met the criteria for progressive disease [PD])

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an adverse event (AE) and a serious adverse event (SAE). However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: CP-751,871
group.description: CP-751,871 0.025, 0.05, 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.8, 1.5, 3 and 6 mg/kg administered intravenously on Day 1 of Cycle 1 (4 weeks or 8 weeks), and dose of 50% from the Cycle 1 dose administered on Day 1 of subsequent cycles, starting from Cycle 2 (4 weeks); CP-751,871 10 and 20 mg/kg administered intravenously on Day 1 of Cycle 1 (4 weeks or 8 weeks) and subsequent cycles, starting from Cycle 2 (4 weeks) (adverse events from all dosing groups were combined as a whole)

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
